title: Onyeeze
author: Onyeeze
content: I'm new here and i dont know anything of this forum, since few day i registered here i have being clicking everywhere and being reading any post that i see, but i want to ask, how can a new newbie know when it right in conversation with people questions. Is it also possible for someone to know when it is responsible to answer question of people correctly. When i was reading the post's of others i find out this particular board is for new people, can i make suggestions in another place that is not this board.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: You simply respond to conversations(or threads) if you think you actually have something decent to contribute, and if what you want to say hasn't been said already. It's that simple.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: You will need to understand this forum first, be active, take note of new topics, see how the replies are. Also read some old topics and see how replies are, check posts that were given merits too. The more you learn the more you will understand more about this forum and the more you will see something good to contribute and how to contribute it.You are a newbie, but you can check other boards too and see if you are able to contribute importantly there as well. All the boards you are able to post is because newbies are not restricted to contribute their too. You can post in almost all boards and you can learn from all boards. Because you are newbie on this forum might not also mean that you are a newbie to all boards on this forum.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: How to know if newbie are ready to respond? I think its when he can understand the topic all about and knew the details to contribute about. Ive seen a lot of newbies who can response nicely, means there are many people serious on posting here. I think its really depend on someone seriousness to contribute and share. Its not bad to join, and even corrected since newbies are newbies and we all knew that they dont know yet to answer perfectly.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: Onyeeze on January 08, 2023, 07:48:08 AMI'm new here and i dont know anything of this forum, since few day i registered here i have being clicking everywhere and being reading any post that i see,You registered yesterday, that doesn't count as a few days and it's not time enough to have become acquainted with how the forum works. Keep reading across the various boards focusing on stickie threads (those are threads that are pinned to the top of each board) and with time you will begin to learn how it works.Improving your use of English can also be helpful to entering discussions and understanding what others are discussing. You can also check for a local board to join to help you communicate better with your community. You can find them from scrolling down at the home page.Quote from: Onyeeze on January 08, 2023, 07:48:08 AMcan i make suggestions in another place that is not this board.Yes you can, if your suggestion is relevant to that board.Each board has a slight description under it which tells what sort of posts should be made there.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Don't think about it too much, otherwise you will always find excuses not to say anything. It's like any group conversation. Join a group that discusses something you are interested in and chip in whenever you have something good to say. Still, you need knowledge and experience before you can start giving out advice and make corrections to the mistakes you notice.There has got to be a reason that brought you to Bitcointalk. Think about what that is and what you want to achieve with your time here.Tell us what you are interested in and why you joined the forum, but do it honestly and without saying what you think others might want to hear.

comments.author: Cryptomultiplier
comments.body: You are indeed new, and with prospects of growing substantially before the year runs out, but only if you carefully navigate the sections, read to understand before making an input in a conversation to avoid deleted post, adhere to the rules governing the boards and its members and most importantly create good topics with reference links where possible.Everyone here started like you, but remained consistent with daily contributions. The learning experience is massive, so you also have to know what kind of knowledge you aim to acquire here. Mind you, this is more of a crypto currency based platform, so if this is where you wanted to be, you will surely gain a lot and earn too along the way as you gain experience.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Is this the first forum you have registered with? If not, why are you asking? All forums are intended for communication and discussion of common interests. If you purposefully decided to learn about bitcoin, to study all its subtleties, you should not worry about such trifles that excite you. Take a walk around the forum, decide what you are interested in, or maybe not clear, and feel free to write. Don't think of a forum as a place with very strict rules and an unfriendly community. On the contrary, by communicating here, you will find out how open, and ready to help your people will be glad to have your presence.Just be yourself, don't play the role of someone you are not.

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: Naturally before responding to a comments or post, you should know what they are talking of and get the right directions of the conversation. This particular thread are basically for newbies and you are entitled to asked whatever you feels to ask and also create any topic you seems has not been created but should be something meaningful and before doing that, you should use the search button to know if someone already created such topic.

comments.author: Majestic-milf
comments.body: It's quite natural to want to partake in a conversation as a newbie because there's always the excitement of wanting to drop your two cents. But what's most important about the forum is to first understand how it works, and since no one is setting a limit for you meet up a certain post count, you try to make your responses as intelligent and on point as possible just as the others have advised.

comments.author: tech30338
comments.body: Sine this is a forum, you are free to suggest or have an opinion and give correct information to others post, even if it contradict to OP post, for example they said that bitcoin is not a digital currency(this is just an example) so your respond is its a crypto currency, then explain it to them in a proper way where it will not offend or, make a person looks bad, it means your educating the OP, everyone could make mistake so its okay, so its only right to correct and help them in the right path, always approach them in a proper way, that's how I respond to post.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: Onyeeze on January 08, 2023, 07:48:08 AMhow can a new newbie know when it right in conversation with people questions. Is it also possible for someone to know when it is responsible to answer question of people correctly.Before you join any conversation or discussion, you should decide yourself that is that conversation or discussion relevant to you (your knowledge, experience and ability to make interesting idea).Is it interesting for you? If you feel that topic (conversation, discussion) is non sense, it does not worth your time to join it, so let's skip it.If it is interesting for you, you must read the opening post (OP) and follow flow of discussion in that topic, from first post to later posts, at least in first one or two pages. If you see questions were answered in first two pages, no need to repeat what others discussed. Of course if you want to be helped by others to clarify some idea, you can join and ask.

comments.author: akuntester1
comments.body: Quote from: Onyeeze on January 08, 2023, 07:48:08 AMI'm new here and i dont know anything of this forum, since few day i registered here i have being clicking everywhere and being reading any post that i see, but i want to ask, how can a new newbie know when it right in conversation with people questions. Is it also possible for someone to know when it is responsible to answer question of people correctly. When i was reading the post's of others i find out this particular board is for new people, can i make suggestions in another place that is not this board.Hey OP, I'm also a newbie here, and as a newbie to this forum I'd advise you to read the threads that have been pinned on this beginner & help board:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1689727.msg16958010#msg16958010In that thread there is a lot of basic information that you can get as a newbie to this forum.So that you can better understand what and how this forum works.In this forum you are free to discuss according to your interests, but this forum also has several rules that must be obeyed by forum users, here are the threads:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.msg7955645#msg7955645Welcome to the forum, I hope it will help you a little to understand this forum.

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: Quote from: Onyeeze on January 08, 2023, 07:48:08 AMbut i want to ask, how can a new newbie know when it right in conversation with people questions. Is it also possible for someone to know when it is responsible to answer question of people correctly.You're free to respond to other member's comments, provided you're going to flow with their stream of thoughts. Don't let the ranks of members intimidate you into believing you aren't qualified to respond to them. First thing is to understand what's being discussed before you make your contributions. Otherwise, you will be making spam or shit posts but thinking you're saying something reasonable.QuoteWhen i was reading the post's of others i find out this particular board is for new people, can i make suggestions in another place that is not this board.Beginners & Help is a good place for beginners as it helps them get their questions easily answered by more experienced members. It's a kind of congregation for newbies but it doesn't mean newbies can't post or start threads anywhere else. Threads are placed in sections that befit the questions asked in the OP or its content. Of course, threads are also moved to the relevant board if they aren't placed in the right board or section in the first place.

comments.author: CryptoPanda
comments.body: There isn’t a newbie prison. You can post anywhere you want. If you read the  Unofficial list of (official) Bitcointalk.org rules the number 1 rule is “1. No zero or low value, pointless or uninteresting posts or threads.” This means you have to make meaningful comments on a topic and if you don’t have knowledge on a subject being discussed you should just read and scroll past. Trying so hard to sound smart or look good may cause you to plagiarize.

comments.author: boyptc
comments.body: Welcome! Quote from: Onyeeze on January 08, 2023, 07:48:08 AMcan i make suggestions in another place that is not this board.Yes, all boards are good for discussions and everyone can join. No rank limit to post and reply on most boards except on the Important Announcements but still, you can read what's posted there.Quote from: Onyeeze on January 08, 2023, 07:48:08 AMIs it also possible for someone to know when it is responsible to answer question of people correctly. As long as you know what you're saying and it's related to the topic/thread and that's how you determine if you'll answer correctly. Other than that, everyone is free to join discussions for any topic that they want as long as you don't say Off topic things because someone will report it and then the mod will have it deleted.

comments.author: Alisha-k
comments.body: Just have a basic knowledge of the thread. Even if you know nothing about what is been discussed you can spend time reading peoples comment and using the search engine as well. Been on track is just having a reply that is both inline with the thread and also answer the question of someone.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: Onyeeze on January 08, 2023, 07:48:08 AMcan i make suggestions in another place that is not this board.Forgot to add in my previous reply that there are a couple of boards which have restrictions, where newbie cannot post.For the serious discussion board; you need to be at least a Jr member with one merit,For Ivory tower child board, you need to be at least full member.Investigations child board also has restrictions for low ranked members.

comments.author: GeorgeJohn
comments.body: Quote from: Onyeeze on January 08, 2023, 07:48:08 AMI'm new here and i dont know anything of this forum, since few day i registered here i have being clicking everywhere and being reading any post that i see, but i want to ask, how can a new newbie know when it right in conversation with people questions. Is it also possible for someone to know when it is responsible to answer question of people correctly. When i was reading the post's of others i find out this particular board is for new people, can i make suggestions in another place that is not this board.You can discuss in any place you feel like to discuss provided that you exactly what you are discussing for,  if you know an answer to a question you can as well provide the answer, so everyone is liable to discuss in any board

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Quote from: Onyeeze on January 08, 2023, 07:48:08 AM-snip-how can a new newbie know when it right in conversation with people questions.  Do you mean a question that needs an absolute (mathematical) answer, then just look at the next reply. If it's a bit inaccurate, someone will argue with a more correct one. As for questions that only need advice or opinions, you only need to take a few that are suitable for you.Quote from: Onyeeze on January 08, 2023, 07:48:08 AM-snip-Is it also possible for someone to know when it is responsible to answer question of people correctly.Every member should be responsible for every published post without exception.
